meanings.definition: Of or relating to the pylorus.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the pyloric region of the stomach.
meanings.sent2: The pyloric valve controls the flow of food from the stomach to the small intestine.
meanings.sent3: The pyloric area seemed to have a mind of its own, deciding when to release food.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as strong as the pyloric muscles.
meanings.sent5: The pyloric function is crucial for proper digestion.

meanings.definition: The opening from the stomach into the duodenum.
meanings.sent1: Food passes through the pyloric into the small intestine for further digestion.
meanings.sent2: The pyloric sphincter regulates the passage of food from the stomach.
meanings.sent3: The pyloric seemed to be the gatekeeper of the digestive system, allowing only approved guests.
meanings.sent4: His words flowed out of him like food through the pyloric, unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The pyloric opening is like a doorway to the next stage of digestion.
